title: Light (monster class)
data:
The **light** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [y](/wiki/Y "Y") glyph (y). Lights are designated internally by the macro `S_LIGHT`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- y [yellow light](/wiki/Yellow_light "Yellow light")
- y [black light](/wiki/Black_light "Black light")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)

  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [1.2 Body parts](#Body_parts)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [3 References](#References)

## Common traits

All lights will explode in your direction if you are adjacent, permanently destroying the light; this causes a [status affliction](/wiki/Property "Property") and creates [noise](/wiki/Noise "Noise") that can wake nearby monsters, but does no damage. As lights cannot [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), if you are [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible") or [displaced](/wiki/Displaced "Displaced"), they may explode at an empty square with no effect on you.

### Generation

Reading a [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") has a 1⁄5 chance of summoning a light monster if they are not [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Reading the scroll while confused now instead summons multiple [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") lights. An uncursed scroll will summon 3–4 yellow lights; a blessed scroll will summon 5–6 yellow lights; and a cursed scroll will summon 3–4 black lights. Nothing will be summoned if the appropriate type of light is genocided.

### Body parts

Lights have a special hard-coded set of [body parts](/wiki/Body_parts "Body parts"), with "hand" replaced with "ray", "handed" replaced with "rayed", and all other body parts replaced with "beam".[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Variants

Many variants add new monsters to the light monster class. Some implement the [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch"), which introduces the [will o' wisp](/wiki/Will_o%27_wisp "Will o' wisp"). Its exact traits vary with the variant in question; in the original patch, they can explode and render you confused for several turns.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [coure eladrin](/index.php?title=Coure_eladrin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Coure eladrin (page does not exist)") take on the form of a mote of light, y, in order to flee and recover health; [Queen Mab](/wiki/Queen_Mab "Queen Mab") uses the form of a "coterie of motes", y, for similar purposes.

Additionally, a tiny being of light, y, appears as one of the many [insight](/wiki/Insight "Insight") merchants.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [its rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") both add the will o' wisp, but implement it differently from the biodiversity patch.

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") incorporates the will o' wisp, with most of the same traits as in the biodiversity patch.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 39](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L39)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 954](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L954)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1729](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L1729)

The light is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase y glyph (y). Lights are designated internally by the macro S_LIGHT.[1]
